qas.question: What skills were the Yun Song Empire known for?

context: This influx was compounded by the decline of the <a0_0>Western Sudanic Mali Empire<a0_0/> in <b4_0>1375<b4_0/> and the Songhai Empire in <b5_0>1591<b5_0/>. Additionally, as inland regions underwent desertification, <a1_0>inhabitants moved to the wetter coast<a1_0/>. These new inhabitants brought skills such as <b8_0>cotton spinning, cloth weaving, iron smelting, rice and sorghum cultivation, and social and political institutions<b8_0/> from the Mali and Songhai empires. Shortly after <b6_0>the Mane<b6_0/> conquered the region, the Vai people of the former Mali Empire immigrated into <a2_0>the Grand Cape Mount region.<a2_0/> <a3_0><b7_0>The ethnic Kru<b7_0/><a3_0/> opposed the influx of Vai, forming an alliance with the Mane to stop further influx of Vai.[citation needed]
